Description: Cylindrical hammerstone made of a very heavy and dense granite (?) in a greyish-greenish colour. The lateral sides shows areas alternating between finer and rougher smoothness. The top end is slightly rounded and shows wear from use as a hammer. The bottom end shows an indent with wear of use as a hammer and possibly as a drill weight. Around the edge of bottom and top end several areas broken off due to the use of the object.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 160)
